jml.structures
Class DisjointSets

java.lang.Object
  jml.structures.DisjointSets

public class DisjointSets
extends java.lang.Object

Title: DisjointSets

Description: This class represents a disjoint sets find-union optimal structure as explained by Cormen et all in Introduction to algorithms. Mac Graw Hill, 1990.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2004

Company: Universidad Nacional de Colombia

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jonatan Gomez

private  int[] p
          Canonical object that represents a set.
private  int[] rank
          The rank of the elements
 
Constructor Summary
DisjointSets(int n)
          Constructor: Creates a disjoint set structure of n objects.
 
Method Summary
 int find(int x)
          Returns the canonical object that represents the set that the object x belongs to

          Returns the canonical elements for each element in the full set

          Initialize the disjoint find union structure.

          An intermediate function for doing the union of two sets

Field Detail

p

private int[] p
Canonical object that represents a set. p[i] = x means that object i belongs to the set represented by object x

rank

private int[] rank
The rank of the elements

Constructor Detail

DisjointSets

public DisjointSets(int n)
Constructor: Creates a disjoint set structure of n objects. Each element defines a set. p[x] = x

Parameters:
n - Number of elements
Method Detail

init

public void init()
Initialize the disjoint find union structure. p[x] = x, rank[x] = 0 for all x

find

public int find(int x)
Returns the canonical object that represents the set that the object x belongs to

Parameters:
x - Element used to determine the canonical object
Returns:
the canonical object that represents the set that the object x belongs to

union

public int union(int x,
                 int y)
Performs the union of the set that contains element x with the set that contains the element y

Parameters:
x - The object that defines the first set to be joint
y - The object that defines the second set to be joint
Returns:
The canonical object of the union set.

link

protected int link(int x,
                   int y)
An intermediate function for doing the union of two sets

Parameters:
x - The canonical object of the first set to be joint
y - The canonical object of the second set to be joint
Returns:
The canonical object of the union set.

get

public int[] get()
Returns the canonical elements for each element in the full set

Returns:
The canonical elements for each element in the full set

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Converts the disjoinfind-union structure to a string

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A string with the disjoinfind-union structure
